channel.title: Data Privacy on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in Data Privacy on 0x000216

item.title: A book comparing Asian data privacy laws to international standards is available
item.description: Graham Greenleaf’s Asian Data Privacy Laws: Trade & Human Rights Perspectives (ISBN 978-0-19-967966-9) is a groundbreaking examination of data privacy legislation across Asia. Source: OUP. Professor Greenleaf, a Law Professor at the University of New South Wales, Australia, and Co-founder and Co-Director of the open-access Australasian Legal Information Institute, explores 26 countries and individual jurisdictions. The book provides a thorough analysis of the 14 jurisdictions with specific data privacy laws, comparing them to global benchmarks.
